source_sentence: 菩薩見實會第十六之十六四轉輪王品第二十六之二「大王！
translation: Chapter 26-2 of the 16-4 Wheel-Turning Kings' Assembly of the Bodhisattva's Vision of Reality, "Great King!

source_sentence: 過去有王名曰地天，如法為王名為法王。
translation: In the past, there was a king named Earth and Heaven who was called the Dharma king because he lived by the Dharma.

source_sentence: 七寶具足，所謂輪寶、象寶、馬寶、明珠寶、玉女寶、長者寶、主兵寶，是名七寶。
translation: He was supplied with seven treasures, which are called the wheel treasure, elephant treasure, horse treasure, pearl treasure, jade lady treasure, elder treasure, and lord's army treasure.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 彼地天王父名曰地生。
translation: "The father of that earth god king is named Earthborn.

source_sentence: 彼地生王臨命終時，其地天最為長子。
translation: When his earth-born king's life ended, the eldest son of that earth god was the eldest son.

source_sentence: 其地生命終之後，輔相大臣灌地天頂以為大王，即為剎利灌頂大王。
translation: When his earthly life ended, an auxiliary minister consecrated the top of the earthly celestials as a great king, which was the great king consecrated by Jalili.

source_sentence: 時地天王既為剎利灌頂王已，於十五日月盛圓滿受齋之日，沐浴洗頭，剪除鬚鬢及以爪甲已，著新淨衣，以諸花鬘、種種瓔珞、天冠臂印、環釧耳璩莊嚴其身，在高樓上婇女圍遶。
translation: After he became the consecrated king of Śāriputra, the earth god king washed his hair on the fifteenth day when the moon was in full bloom and the day of observance, cut off his beard and hair and put on his fingernails, put on new and pure clothing, adorned himself with flower garlands, various kinds of jewelry, a heavenly crown, armlets, and rings and ears, and sat up on a high building surrounded by women.

source_sentence: 即於東方有金輪寶，千輻不減轂輞具足，光明照耀縱廣七肘純是真金。
translation: In the east, there's a gold wheel-treasure with a thousand spokes that doesn't decrease in size and has a full hub, and it shines brightly up to seven elbows wide and is pure true gold.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 時地天王見是事已，即作是念：『我昔曾聞先舊人說，若剎利灌頂王於十五日月圓滿時受齋之日，沐浴洗頭，剪除鬚鬢及除爪甲，著不污衣，以諸花鬘、種種瓔珞、天冠臂印環釧鉺璩莊嚴其身，在高樓上婇女圍遶。
translation: When the goddess king saw this, he thought, 'I've heard from someone of old that on the fifteenth day of observance of the full moon, the consecrated king of the bhadra washes his hair, trims off his beard and nails, puts on undefiled clothing, adorns himself with flower garlands, various kinds of jewelry, and a heavenly crown, armlets, seals, and trimmings, and sits on a high building surrounded by women.

source_sentence: 若於東方有金輪寶，轂輞具足千輻不減而來應者，當知是王定當得作轉輪聖王。』
translation: If there's a golden wheel and jewel in the east with a hub and ring, and it doesn't decrease in size, you should know that this king will surely become a wheel-turning sage king.'

source_sentence: 復作是念：『我今豈可作輪王耶？
translation: Again, he thinks, 'Could I be a wheel-turning sage king now?'

source_sentence: 我今當試。』
translation: I will try it now.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: My lord!

source_sentence: 爾時地天王即從坐起，偏袒右肩，整理衣服，右膝著地，對輪合掌，向彼天輪作如是言：『寶輪可下在地而住。』
translation: At that point, the earth king then rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, adjusted his robes, knelt on his right knee, put his palms together in front of the wheel, and addressed the other celestial wheel, saying, 'The jeweled wheel may descend to the ground and stand there.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，彼天寶輪從空下地，住在王前。
translation: After he said that, the celestial jeweled wheel descended from the sky to the ground and stayed there in front of the king.

source_sentence: 時地天王即以妙香用塗其手，勝妙好衣以拭輪寶，以其右手接取輪寶置左手中。
translation: The earth king then rubbed his hands with a wonderful incense and wiped the wheel treasure with his excellent, fine clothing, and took the wheel treasure in his right hand and placed it in his left hand.

source_sentence: 復以右手摩拭其輪，作如是言：『汝今應當降伏東方。』
translation: Again, he rubbed the wheel with his right hand and wiped it, saying, 'Now, you must subdue the east.'

source_sentence: 作是語已，時金輪寶飛昇虛空左右旋轉，即往東方，至彼往昔轉輪王道。
translation: After he said that, the gold wheel-treasure flew up into the sky, spun from side to side, and went east to that path of wheel-turning kings from the distant past.

source_sentence: 其道平正，布散諸花甚可愛樂。
translation: His path was level and upright, and he spread flowers that were delightful.

source_sentence: 輪所經處皆悉平正無有高下。
translation: Every place that the wheel passes through is perfectly level and straight, with no height.

source_sentence: 以王福力，河池井泉枯竭之處，八功德水悉皆盈滿。
translation: Because of the king's merit, the rivers and pools and wells and dried-up springs are filled with water from the eight excellent qualities.

source_sentence: 一切所有樹林花果枯悴之者悉皆敷榮，已敷榮者更增欝茂。
translation: All the trees, forests, flowers, and fruits that are withered and withered are all glorified, and those that are already glorified grow even more lush.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時地天轉輪聖王即與四兵隨輪而去。
translation: It was then that the earthbound, heavenly wheel-turning sage king and his four soldiers departed following the wheel.

source_sentence: 輪寶若住，王亦隨住。
translation: If the wheel-turning jewel stayed, the king also stayed.

source_sentence: 王所至處所有國土，大小諸王與其臣民，各以金盤盛滿銀粟，或以銀盤盛滿金粟，奉迎大王，各作是言：『善哉大王！
translation: In all the lands the king visited, the kings and subjects of large and small each brought a gold tray full of silver or a silver tray full of gold corn to greet the great king, and each said, 'Good, great king!'

source_sentence: 善來大王！
translation: Well come, great king!

source_sentence: 此諸國土安隱豐樂人民熾盛。
translation: These lands are peaceful and abundant, and their people are flourishing.

source_sentence: 唯願大王受此國土攝化人民，我等皆當奉給左右，唯願止住。』
translation: May it please the king to accept this land as a way to bring its people together, and we will all give our respects to it, asking only that it be stopped.'

source_sentence: 爾時地天轉輪聖王告彼諸國王及臣民等，作如是言：『我今不須國土寶物，汝自受用。
translation: It was then that the earthbound wheel-turning sage king addressed the kings of those countries and their subjects, saying, 'Now, I don't need the treasures of my land; you can use them yourself.

source_sentence: 汝今若欲隨順我者，應離殺生，亦莫偷盜、亦莫邪婬、亦莫妄語、亦莫兩舌、亦勿惡口、亦莫綺語、亦莫貪欲、亦莫瞋恚、亦莫邪見。
translation: Now, if you want to obey me, you must avoid killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, false speech, duplicity, harsh words, fancy speech, craving, anger, and wrong views.

source_sentence: 汝等應當自住十善，亦教他人令住十善，我則知汝歸從於我、受我教勅，我觀汝等猶如我子。
translation: You must abide in the ten good qualities yourselves and teach others to abide in the ten good qualities, so that I know you're subordinate to me and have received my instructions, and I see you as my sons.

source_sentence: 汝等常應供養父母師長及諸沙門婆羅門等，莫作非法不善惡行，亦勸他人令行善法。
translation: You should always support your parents, teachers, elders, ascetics, priests, and so forth, refraining from unlawful, unskillful, and bad actions, and encouraging others to do good things.

source_sentence: 若能如是，我知汝等一切國土所有人民悉皆歸從降伏於我。』
translation: If you can do so, I know that all the people of all your lands will come to me and submit to me.'

source_sentence: 又復告言：『汝等常應孝養父母、恭敬師長及諸沙門諸婆羅門，莫作非法不善惡行，亦勸他人令行善法。
translation: Again, he said, 'You must always be dutiful to your parents, respectful to teachers and elders, ascetics and priests, refrain from unlawful, unwholesome, and bad actions, and encourage others to do good things.

source_sentence: 若能如是，我知汝等一切國土所有人民悉皆歸從降屬於我。』
translation: If you can do so, I know that all the people of all your lands will come under my command.'

source_sentence: 爾時聖王及諸四兵，如是漸漸度於大海降弗婆提，過盡人境輪寶乃住。
translation: The noble king and his four soldiers then gradually crossed the ocean and descended into Pūrvavide, passing beyond the limit of the human realm to the wheel-treasure before they stayed there.

source_sentence: 如是乃至南西北方及欝單越，悉降伏已。
translation: Thus, they all surrendered, even to the north, south, west, and north Uttarakuru.

source_sentence: 度彼北海盡人境已，王及輪寶還閻浮提本宮門上，在虛空中停住不動。
translation: After crossing the northern ocean to the end of the human realm, the king and his wheel-treasure returned to the gate of their home palace in Jambudvīpa and stopped motionless in space.

source_sentence: 爾時地天轉輪聖王如是降伏四天下已，還閻浮提即便止住。
translation: After thus subduing the four worlds, the earthly god Wheel-Turning Sage King returned to Jambudvīpa and even stopped.

source_sentence: 地天大王及與輪寶還來至此閻浮提，時彼四天下變成七寶，端嚴姝特。
translation: When the earth king and the wheel-turning sage king and their wheel-treasure returned to Jambudvīpa, the four worlds were transformed into seven jewels of great splendor and beauty.

source_sentence: 何謂七寶？
translation: What are the seven treasures?

source_sentence: 所謂金、銀、琉璃、頗梨、車璩、赤珠、馬瑙。
translation: It's called gold, silver, beryl, bari, chariot, red pearl, and cornelian.

source_sentence: 爾時輪寶於四天下周迴旋轉已，一切地獄、畜生、餓鬼八難消滅，於四天下所有一切不善惡聲悉皆除滅，況有造作諸惡業者。
translation: After the wheel-treasure circles the four heavens, the eight difficult circumstances of all hells, animals, and hungry ghosts cease, and all unwholesome and bad sounds in the four heavens are all removed, not to mention the creation of bad actions.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 皆是地天聖王本願力故。
translation: It's all because of the power of the original vows of the noble kings of Earth and Heaven.

source_sentence: 又復輪寶周旋轉時，四天下中不假種植，處處皆生自然秔米，淨無糠糩。
translation: Also, when the wheel-treasure revolves around, naturally fructose rice, pure and without chaff, is produced everywhere in the four heavens without any pretence of being planted.

source_sentence: 又復輪寶周旋轉時，四天下中自然而生天樹寶衣。
translation: When the wheel of the wheel's treasure revolves, the four heavens naturally produce jeweled clothing made of celestial trees.

source_sentence: 又復輪寶周旋轉時，四天下中一切病患悉皆除愈，唯除三患。
translation: When the wheel of the wheel's treasure revolves around, all the illnesses in the four heavens are healed, and only three of those illnesses are removed.

source_sentence: 何等為三？
translation: What are the three?

source_sentence: 一者求欲，二者段食，三者衰老。
translation: One seeks desire, two obtains food, and three ages.

source_sentence: 又復輪寶旋轉之時，四天下中所有人民壽千萬歲。
translation: Also, when the wheel-treasure revolves, all the people in the four heavens have lives of ten million years.

source_sentence: 又復輪寶周旋轉時，四天下中一切人民所有苦惱自然消滅。
translation: When the wheel-treasure revolves, the suffering and distress of all the people in the four heavens naturally cease.

source_sentence: 如是等無量無邊希有不可思議之事出現於世。
translation: Such measureless, limitless, rare, and unfathomable things like this appear in the world.

source_sentence: 「爾時地天大王復於久時作如是念：『我今於此受諸快樂，五欲眾具頗更有處勝此以不？』
translation: "At the time, the Earth God Maharaja again had this thought for a long time, 'Now, I'm enjoying all the pleasures here, so how could there be a place that's superior to these five desirable things?'

source_sentence: 復自思念：『我昔曾聞須彌頂上有三十三天，五欲資具其事云何？』
translation: Again, he thought, 'I once heard that there are the Trāyastriṃśa gods on the summit of Sumeru, and what are the five requisites of desire?'

source_sentence: 爾時地天大王未除愛欲，厭惡人間所有五欲資財之具，欣彼天中上妙之樂。
translation: At the time, the great king of the earth gods hadn't yet gotten rid of his cravings, disliked all the five desires and the necessities of possessions here on earth, and longed for the superior pleasures of those heavens.

source_sentence: 『我今寧可往彼天上。』
translation: 'Now, I'd rather go up there to heaven.'

source_sentence: 爾時地天大王作是念已，王及四兵忽然之頃至忉利天。
translation: After the earth king then had this thought, the king and his four soldiers suddenly arrived in the Heaven of Thirty-three.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋遙見地天大王，作如是言：『善來大王！
translation: It was then that Tīrṣa saw the great king of Earth from a distance and said, 'Well done, great king!

source_sentence: 善哉大王！』
translation: Good, great king!'

source_sentence: 即分半座命王令坐。
translation: He then ordered the king to sit down on half of his seat.

source_sentence: 王即就坐。
translation: The king then took his seat.

source_sentence: 爾時地天在彼天上經無量百千歲分位而治。
translation: At the time, Earth Heaven had been in that heaven for measureless hundreds of thousands of years and was ruling from position to position.

source_sentence: 爾時地天大王復於久時生大貪心，作如是念：『我今應當退彼天主獨為天王。』
translation: After a long time, the earth god Mahākauṣṭhila also became very greedy and had this thought, 'Now, I should retire from that lord of heaven and become king of heaven alone.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即從帝釋半座而墮，并及四兵至閻浮提安隱城中。
translation: After that thought, he fell halfway across Indra's throne with his four soldiers into the peaceful city of Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 爾時地天大王久在天上受勝妙樂心生耽樂，忽至人間不能堪受人中資具，身心沈沒，猶如醍醐置熱沙中尋即消化，莫知所在。
translation: After a long time in the heavens enjoying wonderful pleasures, the earth god king suddenly went to the human realm, unable to accept the necessities of being human, and sank down physically and mentally like ghee put in hot sand that's immediately digested, and he didn't know where it was.

source_sentence: 地天大王身心沈沒不能堪忍人中所有飲食精氣，亦復如是。
translation: The same goes for the earth god Mahākauṣṭhila, who is physically and mentally submerged and can't tolerate the energy of food and drink that exists among humans.

source_sentence: 爾時地天大王身心疲頓而說偈言：「『諸王大自在，　　不能除渴愛，　　如乾草遇火，　　是故應捨欲。
translation: At the time, the earth god Mahākauṣṭhila became physically and mentally exhausted and spoke a verse, saying, "Those kings are so sovereign that they can't get rid of thirst and desire, like dry grass on fire; therefore, they should abandon desire.

source_sentence: 常行於婬欲，　　未曾滿足時，　　如渴飲鹹水，　　終不能除渴。
translation: When you're constantly engaged in sexual desire and never satisfy it, it's like drinking salty water when you're thirsty; it never quenches your thirst.

source_sentence: 如眾流歸海，　　終無有滿足，　　愛欲亦如是，　　曾無滿足時。
translation: Like many currents returning to the ocean, there's never any fulfillment, and so are desires and wants, which are never fulfilled.

source_sentence: 如火焚草木，　　無有厭足時，　　愛欲亦如是，　　終無有滿足。
translation: Like fire that burns grass and trees, when there's no tire of it, so too are desires and wants that are never fulfilled.

source_sentence: 猶如深谷響，　　隨聲無休息，　　聞聲亦如是，　　亦無休息時。
translation: It's like the sound of a deep valley that follows without rest, and so is the sound heard, and there's no time of rest.

source_sentence: 亦如盛香篋，　　受香無簡擇，　　嗅香亦如是，　　亦無有厭足。
translation: It's like a container full of incense, which receives incense without brief selection and smells incense likewise, and there's no getting tired of it.

source_sentence: 如杓撓美食，　　終無知止足，　　舌貪嗜美味，　　亦無於止足。
translation: Like a ladle that churns delicious food, it never knows when to stop, and the tongue craves delicious food, and there's no stopping it.

source_sentence: 如鏡現面像，　　亦無有厭足，　　如是行欲人，　　於欲無厭足。
translation: Like a mirror that shows a face, it has no weariness, and thus a person who engages in desires has no weariness in desires.

source_sentence: 如虛空受風，　　未曾有厭足，　　身常受諸觸，　　終無厭足時。
translation: Like the wind blowing through space, he never gets tired of it, and his body always experiences touch, but he never gets tired of it.

source_sentence: 如夢中飲水，　　終不能除渴，　　意所受諸法，　　亦無有厭足。
translation: Like drinking water in a dream that never quenches one's thirst, the mind experiences qualities that have no weariness.

source_sentence: 貪求愛欲人，　　復增長愛欲，　　觀於諸境界，　　愛無厭足時。
translation: When a person craves desires and grows in desires, they observe the objects and never tire of desires.

source_sentence: 見欲增苦惱，　　猶如火焚薪，　　滅除諸愛欲，　　亦如水滅火。』」
translation: Seeing desires that increase suffering and distress is like fire burning wood, and ceasing desires is like water extinguishing fire.'"

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 汝知爾時地天大王豈異人乎？
translation: Do you know whether the Earth and Heaven kings were different people at that time?

source_sentence: 大王當知，勿作異觀，地天王者即我身是。
translation: You should know, Your Majesty, not to look at it differently, that the Earth God King is me.

source_sentence: 大王當知，彼地天大王往昔之時豪富自在，貪求無厭遂便命終。
translation: You should know, Your Majesty, that Earth God King was once so wealthy and powerful that he had no trouble pursuing his desires and then ended up dead.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 諸根無厭，境無能滿；諸根如鏡，境如光影；諸根如幻，境界如夢。
translation: The faculties are unwearying, and the objective realm is unfullfilled; the faculties are like a mirror, and the objective realm is like light and shadow; the faculties are illusory, and the objective realm is like a dream.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 應當安心此法，深自觀察，勿隨他教。
translation: You should rest assured about this teaching, deeply examine it for yourself, and don't follow the teachings of others.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 此法乃是過去未來現在諸佛世尊無上菩提。
translation: "This teaching is the unsurpassed enlightenment of the buddhas of the past, future, and present.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 應當遠離一切豪貴，應當消竭一切渴海、倒憍慢山、遠離一切衰禍。
translation: They should be free of all wealth and power, and they should quench all oceans of thirst, reverse mountains of conceit, and avoid all misfortune.

source_sentence: 於一切法平等，非一切凡夫地，亦非聲聞之所能行，又非一切緣覺境界，乃是一切菩薩所行，一切諸佛正覺所證。
translation: Their equality in regard to all things is not the level of all worldlings, nor is it something that direct disciples can do, nor is it the realm of all pratyekbuddhas, but it's something practiced by all bodhisattvas and realized by all the buddhas who are directly enlightened.

source_sentence: 王當安心勿令散亂，應作是念：『我當云何於未來世，一切世間天人之中，得為燈明、為炬、為光、為船、為導、為師、得為商主、為首、為無上，自度度彼、自脫脫彼、自安安彼、自得涅槃令他涅槃。』
translation: Don't let your mind be distracted, and think, 'How will I, in the future among all the gods and humans of the world, become a lamp, a torch, a light, a ship, a guide, a teacher, a merchant, a leader, and unsurpassed, passing myself over them, liberating myself from them, making myself comfortable with them, and attaining nirvāṇa for myself so that others may attain nirvāṇa?'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 莫觀先際所更豪富自在，大王當知，諸根如幻，無有厭足、無能滿者；境界如夢，不能令滿。」
translation: Don't look at what was previously greater in wealth and power, for you, my lord, should know that faculties are like illusions that have nothing to tire of and nothing to fulfill; objects are like dreams that can't be made to fulfill."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 過去有王名曰頂生，有大威德、有大神足、有大威勢，從父烏哺沙王頂上而生。
translation: In the past, there was a king named Tiṅgāra who had great authority, great spiritual powers, and great might and was born from the top of his father's head, King Uṣa.

source_sentence: 久積善根，曾見無量無數諸佛，修諸善根。
translation: He had accumulated good roots over time, had seen measureless and countless buddhas, and cultivated good roots.

source_sentence: 於諸世尊恭敬供養積集善本，於四天下豪貴自在。
translation: He respects the world-honored ones, makes offerings, and amasses a stock of good roots, and he has great dignity and control in the four worlds.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 時頂生王灌頂受位七日已！
translation: It was seven days after the consecration of the crown prince!

source_sentence: 得七寶具足為轉輪王。
translation: Attaining the full possession of seven treasures, he becomes a wheel-turning king.

source_sentence: 何者為七？
translation: What are the seven?

source_sentence: 一者金輪寶，千輻不減轂輞具足，自然而有，縱廣七肘，而來應之。
translation: One is a golden-wheel treasure with a thousand spokes that doesn't decrease and a hub that's perfectly proportioned, which naturally appears even though it's seven cubits wide and responds.

source_sentence: 二者白象寶，六牙具足、七肢拄地、白如雪山，自然而至。
translation: Second, there's the white elephant treasure, which has six tusks and legs supporting the ground and is as white as a snow mountain, and it naturally arrives.

source_sentence: 三者馬寶，其色紺艷而來應之。
translation: Third, there's the horse treasure, which has a violet color and comes to meet him.

source_sentence: 此上象馬從旦至食，於四天下周遍八方，盡大海際還住本處。
translation: From sunrise until sunset, these elephants and horses travel everywhere under the four heavens and in the eight directions until the end of the ocean, when they return to their original place.

source_sentence: 四者珠寶，大如人髀，純青琉璃其光照曜，周匝八方各一由旬。
translation: The fourth is a jewel as large as a man's thigh, pure blue beryl whose light shines brightly, and which circles the eight directions for a leap of a month each.

source_sentence: 五者長者寶，豐饒財寶巨富無量，隨王所念皆能辦之，自然而應。
translation: Fifth, an elder treasure that's abundant in wealth and possessions, so great and immeasurable that it can naturally respond to the king's desires.

source_sentence: 六者玉女寶，形容端正微妙第一，不長不短、不白不黑，身諸毛孔出栴檀香，口氣淨潔如青蓮花，其舌廣大出能覆面，形色細薄如赤銅鍱，身體柔軟猶如無骨，冬溫夏涼，其心慈悲常出軟語，以手觸王即知王心所念之處。
translation: Sixth, the Jade Lady is a jewel of the finest description, neither long nor short, neither white nor black, with sandalwood fragrance emanating from her pores, a pure breath like a blue lotus flower, a broad tongue that covers her face, a thin form like a red copper sheet, a supple body like a boneless one that's warm in winter and cool in summer, a compassionate heart that always speaks softly, and a hand that touches the king and knows what the king's mind is thinking.

source_sentence: 七者主兵寶，自然而出，勇猛策謀武略第一，預知王心七日所念，善知四兵鬪戰之法，未集者令集、已集者令散。
translation: The seventh is a lord of armaments who naturally emerges, is the most courageous, resourceful, and resourceful, anticipates the thoughts of the king's mind for seven days, and well knows the rules for fighting with four armies, causing those who have yet to assemble to assemble and those who have already assembled to disperse.

source_sentence: 千子具足，勇健端正能降怨敵。
translation: They have a thousand sons who are complete, courageous, and correct, and can subdue enemies.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生轉輪聖王七寶具足，王四天下如法化世，令四天下豐樂安隱人民熾盛，城邑聚落次第相近雞飛相及。
translation: At the time, the crown prince, the wheel-turning sage king, was supplied with seven treasures, and he transformed the world according to the Dharma, making the four worlds abundant, comfortable, and prosperous for the people, with cities and towns approaching each other in sequence and fowls flying about.

source_sentence: 爾時大地一切無有沙礫荊棘，多饒眾寶，具足無量園林泉池，端嚴姝妙甚可愛樂。
translation: At the time, the whole earth was devoid of sand, gravel, and thorns, abundant in many treasures, and replete with measureless gardens, forests, springs, and pools that were beautiful and beautiful and very desirable.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 皆是頂生聖王安住法力。
translation: "They're all the power of the noble king's well-established dharma at the top of his lungs.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，若天若人受欲樂中最為第一。
translation: At the time, if there were gods or humans, they'd be the most eminent among those who experience desire and pleasure.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生大王所住之城名阿踰闍，其城東西十二由旬，南北長七由旬。
translation: The city in which the great king Tiṣya was staying was called Ayodhyā, and it measured 12 leagues from east to west and 7 leagues from north to south.

source_sentence: 其城七寶，眾寶羅網彌覆其上，懸眾寶鈴。
translation: It was covered by a net of seven jewels and hung with bells of many jewels.

source_sentence: 其城內外種種莊嚴，悉皆如上無量稱王寶莊嚴城等無有異，亦如忉利得勝之堂。
translation: The various adornments inside and outside of the city are like the above adorned city of immeasurable treasures of the king, and they're no different than the hall in which Trāyastriṃśa attained victory.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 頂生大王造三種殿：一名月出殿，於盛夏熱時王居其中；其第二殿名毘琉璃藏，於春月時王居其中；其第三殿名日威德起，於冬寒時王居其中。
translation: The great king Tiṅsō built three kinds of halls: a moon-escaping hall in which the king resides during the heat of summer, a second hall called the Virūḍhaka hall in which the king resides during the spring months, and a third hall called the Sun's Majestic Rise in which the king resides during the cold of winter.

source_sentence: 爾時頂生與玉女寶并諸婇女，前後圍繞入月出殿。
translation: At the time, the top of his head, the jeweled female jewel, and his daughters surrounded him from front to back as he entered the moon-drawn palace.

source_sentence: 時身體清涼，猶如牛頭栴檀塗其身體。
translation: Their bodies were then cool and fresh, like the oxhead sandalwood that coats their bodies.

source_sentence: 王與眷屬前後圍遶，若入彼毘琉璃殿時，身心調適，猶如多摩羅葉香用塗其身。
translation: When the king and his retinue surround them, if they enter that vaiḍūrya hall, their bodies and minds are refreshed, just like the Tamālapatra fragrance that coats their bodies.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 其頂生大王復與眷屬婇女圍遶，入彼日威德殿時，身體和煖，猶如沈水香用塗其身，入彼殿時身體和煖亦復如是。
translation: When he entered the Sunlight Vantage Hall, he was surrounded by his retinue and women, and his body was warm and moist like the fragrance of sunken water that coats his body, and his body was warm and moist like that when he entered the hall.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 是頂生王隨欲自在，令諸殿等隨其時節而生樂觸，隨意出風、隨意出雨，種種音樂隨意而至，資生所須亦隨意現。
translation: This is the paramount king who has control over desires, causes the temples and others to experience pleasant sensations according to their seasons, produces wind and rain as he wishes, has music of various kinds come as he wishes, and has the necessities for sustenance manifest as he wishes.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生於其宮內，七日之中天雨金銀。
translation: At the time, the top of his head was born inside his palace, and for seven days it rained gold and silver from the sky.

source_sentence: 過七日已作如是念：『甚奇希有不可思議，如此清淨之業所獲果報，隨意而現充滿我意，福德所致無差違也。
translation: After seven days had passed, he thought, 'That's a rare and unfathomable thing, for the result of such pure actions to manifest itself as I wish, with no difference in merit.

source_sentence: 誰有得見如是果報，於修福德而生知足？』
translation: Who has ever seen such a result and become satisfied with cultivating virtue?'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 頂生聖王於閻浮提經百千歲已，作如是念：『我今於此，閻浮大洲安隱豐樂，人民熾盛悉皆歸屬；於我宮內七日雨寶。
translation: After he had passed a hundred thousand years in Jambudvīpa, the noble king at the top of his lungs had this thought, 'Now, here in Jambudvīpa, the great continent is peaceful and abundant, and the people are all raging in support; it rains treasure inside my palace for seven days.

source_sentence: 我今當往西瞿陀尼。』
translation: Now, I'll go to western Gautama.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，頂生大王即與四兵上昇虛空，從閻浮提漸次至彼西瞿陀尼。
translation: After he had this thought, the great king Cisara and his four soldiers ascended into the sky and gradually reached Śigodānī from Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 王既至彼，於無量百千歲在彼王領。
translation: Once the king arrived there, he spent measureless hundreds of thousands of years in his royal highness's employ.

source_sentence: 頂生大王依報過人未得天報。
translation: The king's retribution was greater than that of a human being who hadn't yet attained the reward of heaven.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 頂生聖王於瞿陀尼，隨意雨寶滿其宮內，如閻浮提等無有異。
translation: At Gautama, the crown prince rains down treasure as he wishes, filling his palace like nothing else in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生復於後時作如是念：『我王閻浮提，豐樂安隱人民熾盛，又於宮內隨意雨寶。
translation: It was then that the crown jewel again had this thought: "My king, Yambudvīpa, is rich and peaceful, and his people are flourishing, and he rains treasure at will inside his palace.

source_sentence: 此瞿陀尼，亦皆安隱豐樂人民熾盛，又於宮內隨意雨寶。
translation: This Godānīya is also peaceful and prosperous, and its people are flourishing, and it rains down treasures at will inside its palace.

source_sentence: 我今亦知東有大洲名弗婆提，我今當往。』
translation: Now, I also know that there's a large continent in the east named Pūrvavide, and I will go there now.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即與四兵俱昇虛空，從瞿陀尼漸次而往東弗婆提。
translation: After he thought this, he and his four soldiers rose into the sky and gradually went from Gautama to Pūrvavatī in the east.

source_sentence: 王既至彼，於弗婆提止住王領，無量千歲受五欲樂，依報過人未得天報。
translation: Once the king arrived there, he stayed at the king's palace in Pūrvavide, where he enjoyed the five desires for measureless thousands of years and relied on rewards greater than those of humans who hadn't yet attained the rewards of heaven.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 頂生聖王於弗婆提隨意雨寶滿其宮內，如閻浮提等無有異。
translation: Atop all births, the noble king filled his palace with jewelry as he pleased in Pūrvavide, just like Jambudvīpa and so forth.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生復於後時作如是念：『我閻浮提豐樂安隱人民熾盛，又於宮內隨意雨寶。
translation: It was then that the paramount being also had this thought at some point later, 'I, Yambudvīpa, am abundantly happy and prosperous, and my people are flourishing, and I'm raining treasure at will inside the palace.

source_sentence: 及瞿陀尼，亦皆安隱豐樂人民熾盛，亦於宮內隨意雨寶。
translation: Gautama and Gautama also are all peaceful and prosperous, and the people are flourishing, and they rain down treasure as they like inside the palace.

source_sentence: 此弗婆提，皆悉安隱豐樂人民熾盛，亦於宮內隨意雨寶。
translation: Here in Pūrvavideha, they are all peaceful, prosperous, and the people are flourishing, and they rain down treasure inside the palace as they like.

source_sentence: 我今亦知北有大洲名欝單越，其中人民無我我所。
translation: Now, I also know that there's a large continent to the north called Uttarakuru, and the people there have no self or possessions.

source_sentence: 雖復如此，我當往彼自試眷屬。』
translation: Even so, I'll go there and test my own retinue.'

source_sentence: 頂生大王作是念已，與其四兵俱昇虛空，從弗婆提漸次而往北欝單越。
translation: After he thought this, the great king of Tiberias rose into the sky with his four soldiers and gradually went from Pūrvavide to Uttarakuru in the north.

source_sentence: 王既至彼，於欝單越無量千歲教誡眷屬。
translation: Once he arrived there, the king spent measureless thousands of years in Uttarakuru teaching and disciplining his retinue.

source_sentence: 復於久時作如是念：『我閻浮提豐樂安隱已雨七寶，及瞿陀尼人民熾盛安隱雨寶，東弗婆提亦皆如是隨意雨寶，此欝單越悉亦安隱。
translation: After a long time, he had this thought, 'I have rained seven treasures in Jambudvīpa that are abundant and peaceful, and I've rained treasures in Gautama that are abundant and peaceful, and I've rained treasures at will in eastern Pūrvavatī, so this is Uttarakuru that's also peaceful.

source_sentence: 我曾聞有三十三天住須彌頂，我今當往躬自觀之。』
translation: I've heard that there are the Trāyastriṃśa gods living at the summit of Sumeru, so now I will go and examine them for myself.'

source_sentence: 爾時頂生作是念已，即與四兵俱昇虛空住須彌山頂。
translation: After he thought this, Tiṣya rose with his four soldiers into the sky to stand on the summit of Mt. Sumeru.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，釋提桓因與三十三天集善法堂論人天事。
translation: At the time, Śakra Devānām-Indra and the Trāyastriṃśa gods gathered in the Hall of the Fine Dharma to discuss the affairs of humans and gods.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋遙見頂生從遠而來，即出迎之，作如是言：『善來大王！
translation: At the time, Indra saw Tiṃsō coming from afar, went out to meet him, and said, 'Well come, great king!

source_sentence: 善來至此。』
translation: Come well, come here.'

source_sentence: 即分半座命王令坐。
translation: He then ordered the king to sit down on half of his seat.

source_sentence: 王即就座。
translation: The king then took his seat.

source_sentence: 時頂生王坐半座時，即有十種勝事映蔽諸天。
translation: When the king attained half of his seat, there were ten remarkable things that reflected off the gods.

source_sentence: 何等為十？
translation: What are the ten?

source_sentence: 一者壽命勝天，二者容色勝天，三者名稱勝天，四者受樂勝天，五者王領自在勝天，六者形貌勝天，七者音聲勝天，八者香氣勝天，九者食味勝天，十者細觸勝天。
translation: 1) Longevity is superior to the gods, 2) Appearance is superior to the gods, 3) Names are superior to the gods, 4) Pleasure is superior to the gods, 5) The king's dominion is superior to the gods, 6) Appearance is superior to the gods, 7) Sound is superior to the gods, 8) Smell is superior to the gods, 9) Food is superior to the gods, and 10) Fine Touch is superior to the gods.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生與彼帝釋，形容相貌行動威儀等無差別，飲食衣服資生之具悉無有異，唯有視瞬為別異耳。
translation: At the time, there was no difference between Tiṣya and Indra in their physical appearance, actions, manner, and so forth, and there was no difference in the food and clothing they ate and the necessities of life, except for their perception of transience as distinct.

source_sentence: 而諸天等分別識知，天王、人王二種之別。」
translation: The gods then discriminated and knew the difference between the two kinds of god kings and human kings."

source_sentence: 佛言：「大王！
translation: The Buddha said, "Great king!

source_sentence: 甚奇希有。
translation: "It's rare and amazing.

source_sentence: 帝釋、頂生人天既別，形容相貌等無有異。
translation: Although Indra and Pṛthivī are different, there's no difference in their descriptions and appearances.

source_sentence: 大王當知，福德之力其事如是。
translation: You should know, Your Majesty, that this is how the power of good fortune works.

source_sentence: 誰於福德而生足也？
translation: Who is endowed with the power of virtue?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生在忉利天，無量千歲為增上自在。
translation: At that point, the top of his head was born in the Heaven of Thirty-three, where he spent measureless thousands of years as a superior sovereign.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生於四天下豪富自在，復於忉利天上豪富自在，帝釋分治猶不厭足，復作是念：『我今寧可獨為天主，何用帝釋？
translation: At the time, the paramount being was rich and powerful in the four heavens and rich and powerful in the Heaven of Thirty-three, and he still wasn't tired of being subdued by Indra, but he also thought, 'Now, I'd rather be the lord of the gods alone, why should I use Indra?'

source_sentence: 宜應退之。』
translation: It's advisable to retire from it.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: My lord!

source_sentence: 爾時頂生作是念已，從天退下還閻浮提，於阿踰闍城最上園中。
translation: After this thought occurred to him, the god retired from the heavens and returned to Jambudvīpa in the highest park of Ayodhyā.

source_sentence: 王當下時，威光照曜遍閻浮提，一切諸方映蔽日光。
translation: When the king descended, a mighty radiance shone throughout Jambudvīpa, and the sun's light was obscured in all directions.

source_sentence: 亦如日出月無光明，日光在空無復光明。
translation: It's like when the sun rises and the moon has no light, and daylight in space has no more light.

source_sentence: 王光映蔽亦復如是。
translation: So too does the king's light obscure it.

source_sentence: 如日輪出映蔽月輪，頂生威光映彼日輪亦復如是。
translation: Just as the sun rises and reflects off the moon, so does the authoritative light from the top of the head reflect off the sun.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時阿踰城人出城遊觀，見彼頂生并及四兵從天而退墮其園中。
translation: It was then that a man from Ayodhyā went out of the city to look around and saw that godlike being and four soldiers fall back from the sky into his garden.

source_sentence: 彼人見已怪未曾有，即入城中遍告城人言：『今有天子并及四兵從空而下，墮彼王最上園中。』
translation: When he saw that, he wondered if it had ever happened before, so he went into the city and told everyone in the city, 'Now, a god and four soldiers have fallen from the sky into the king's paramount garden.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時城中王及臣民，辦具種種歌舞伎樂、塗香末香、寶幢幡蓋、花鬘瓔珞，身體衣服悉皆清淨，速疾出城詣彼園中。
translation: At the time, the king and his subjects quickly left the city with a variety of songs, dances, music, perfume, banners, flowers, and jewelry, and their bodies and robes were all purified, and they went to that park.

source_sentence: 大王，爾時頂生從天墮時，一切大地六種震動。
translation: At the time, Maharaja, when the top of the head fell from the sky, the whole earth shook in six ways.

source_sentence: 當爾之時，一切人中所有莊嚴，最勝妙香用塗其身，悉至園中頂生王所。
translation: At the time, all the adornments and most excellent and wonderful fragrances among people coated his body and went to the top of the king's head in the garden.

source_sentence: 爾時頂生耽著天中上妙資產，不能堪忍人中資具所有香氣，沈惛在地。
translation: At the time, the paramount being was so absorbed in the most wonderful assets in the heavens that he couldn't tolerate the scent of the necessities among humans and sank to the ground.

source_sentence: 喻如生蘇醍醐投極熱沙中不得停住，爾時頂生沈惛不住亦復如是。
translation: It's like when butter or ghee is thrown into extremely hot sand and can't be stopped, so too does the paramount being sink into delusion and not stop.

source_sentence: 爾時城中王及臣民內外人眾，見頂生王在彼園中沈惛在地，即便問言：『天為是誰？』
translation: It was then that the king of the city and his subjects, both internal and external, saw the king of the gods growing up in that garden, sunken to the ground, and even asked, 'Who are the gods?'

source_sentence: 爾時頂生即告彼王及諸人民言：『汝昔曾聞有頂生大王不？』
translation: It was then that Tiyo addressed the king and his people, saying, 'Did you ever hear of a great king Tiyo?'

source_sentence: 爾時國王及諸人民咸皆答言：『我昔曾從耆舊人所聞有大王名曰頂生，不捨人身，將諸眷屬并及四兵而昇天上。』
translation: The king and his people then all answered, 'I once heard from someone of great vintage that there was a great king named Tiṅgārjuna who didn't abandon his person and ascended to heaven with his retinue and four soldiers.'

source_sentence: 爾時頂生告諸人言：『昔頂生者我身是也。
translation: At that point, Tiyo addressed the people, saying, 'In the past, Tiyo was born, and I was the one who rose.

source_sentence: 我及四兵從天而墮。』
translation: I and my four soldiers fell from heaven.'

source_sentence: 爾時國王及城內外所有人眾，即以偈頌問頂生曰：「『我從舊人所，　　聞有威德王，　　號名曰頂生，　　極有大名稱。
translation: The king and all the people inside and outside the city then asked Tiṅsō in a verse, 'I heard from someone in the past about a mighty king named Tiṅsō who had a very great reputation.

source_sentence: 已身及四兵，　　從此昇天上，　　并及諸眷屬，　　法王如法治。』
translation: He has ascended to heaven with his body and four soldiers, and he has ascended with his retinue, thus ruling the Dharma king.'

source_sentence: 人天勝王言：　　『無常力所害，　　退天樂受苦，　　頂生者我是。』
translation: The victorious king of humans and gods said, 'I am the one who retires from heavenly pleasure and suffering because of the power of impermanence, and I am the one who gives rise to the peak.'

source_sentence: 諸人皆合掌，　　頂禮大王足：　『有何希有事，　　未來當傳說？』
translation: They all joined their palms and bowed their heads at the king's feet, 'What's so rare about it that we'll tell about it in the future?'

source_sentence: 從天而退者，　　受苦王說言：　『汝聽希有事，　　欣樂莫放逸。
translation: When he retreats from heaven, the king of suffering says, 'Listen, there's something rare, and don't let go of your happiness.

source_sentence: 頂生大王者，　　統領四天下，　　受樂過天人，　　欲無厭致死。
translation: The great king who rises from the top rules the four heavens and enjoys pleasures greater than those of gods, desiring to die without tiring.

source_sentence: 於其後宮內，　　七日雨珍寶，　　如法治天下，　　欲無厭而死。
translation: Inside his palace, he rains treasure for seven days, rules the world as he should, and wishes to die without tiring.

source_sentence: 與彼天帝釋，　　分半座而坐，　　惡覺所惱亂，　　多欲故退墮。
translation: He sits with that god Indra halfway up his seat, disturbed by bad feelings, and he falls back because of many desires.

source_sentence: 於其生死海，　　無智故沈沒，　　樂著五欲者，　　天欲無厭死。
translation: In that ocean of birth and death, he's sunken without knowledge, and he's attracted to the five desires, so he dies without tire of the gods' desires.

source_sentence: 如渴夢飲水，　　不能除其渴，　　受五欲亦爾，　　終無有厭足。
translation: Like a thirsty person who dreams of drinking water but can't quench that thirst, so too does he experience the five desires, never tiring of them.

source_sentence: 智慧諸眾生，　　斷除愚癡闇，　　彼智者知足，　　正觀諸有趣。
translation: For those wise sentient beings who have ended the darkness of foolishness, their wisdom is satisfied, and they correctly observe what's interesting.

source_sentence: 智觀察有趣，　　慧見老病死，　　斷除諸渴愛，　　捨有趣無著。
translation: Wisdom observes interesting things, wisdom sees old age, illness, and death, stops craving, and abandons interesting things without attachment.

source_sentence: 觀觸如火燒，　　便捨於渴愛，　　觀受亦如是，　　知受是非善。
translation: He observes touch as fire burns and then abandons craving, observes feeling likewise, and knows that feeling is good and not good.

source_sentence: 如擊眾音樂，　　根境界亦然，　　聖教中調伏，　　能捨根自性。
translation: Like striking music, it's likewise in the sense faculties and objective realms, which are disciplined by the noble teaching and can be abandoned to their own nature.

source_sentence: 一切五種入，　　從於名色生，　　識於中分別，　　則生於思覺。
translation: All five kinds of sense-fields arise from name-and-form, and when consciousness is discriminated within them, contemplation arises.

source_sentence: 聖者作是觀，　　於趣有不著，　　智者慧滿足，　　證滅如薪盡。』
translation: Thus does the noble observe that there's no attachment to destinies, and the wisdom of the intelligent fulfills them, realizing that cessation is like the end of firewood.'

source_sentence: 頂生向彼王，　　臣民說是已，　　示諸有無常，　　即便取終沒。」
translation: After the ruler and his subjects said this, he showed them that all things are impermanent, and they even ended up disappearing."

source_sentence: 佛告大王：「汝知爾時頂生王者，豈異人乎？
translation: The Buddha told the king, "Do you know whether that person Tijuangsheng was different from the king at the time?

source_sentence: 勿作異觀，莫生疑惑，我身是也。
translation: Don't look at it differently, and don't have any doubts about what I am.

source_sentence: 我昔曾為頂生王時，統領人天豪貴自在，貪欲無厭而取終沒。
translation: Once, when I was king of the gods, I ruled over the noble and powerful among humans and gods with great freedom, and I had unceasing desire for it and ended up losing it.

source_sentence: 是故大王！
translation: Therefore, Great King!

source_sentence: 應捨豪富憍慢自在，住不放逸。
translation: He should abandon the pride and arrogance of wealth and abide in nonfrivolity.

source_sentence: 若能住於不放逸行，是人即能修諸善根。
translation: If someone can abide in nonfrivolous behavior, they'll be able to cultivate good roots.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 若不放逸者，復能入於法界平等。
translation: If someone isn't careless, they'll again be able to enter the equality of the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 若人能離放逸者，成就利益。
translation: If someone can avoid dissipation, they'll achieve benefit.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 有為無為界，非男非女、非過去非未來非現在。
translation: The realm of being and non-being is neither male nor female, neither past nor future, and neither present.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 當於此法安住自心，勿隨他教。
translation: You must abide in this teaching in your own mind and not follow the teachings of others.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 此法乃是過去未來現在諸佛世尊無上菩提。
translation: "This teaching is the unsurpassed enlightenment of the buddhas of the past, future, and present.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 應當遠離一切豪貴，消竭一切渴海，倒憍慢山，遠離一切衰禍。
translation: They should be free of all wealth and power, quench all seas of thirst, reverse mountains of conceit, and avoid all misfortune.

source_sentence: 於一切平等，非一切凡夫地，亦非聲聞之所能行，又非一切緣覺境界，乃是一切菩薩所行，一切諸佛正覺所證。
translation: Their equality in all things is not the level of all worldlings, nor is it something that śrāvakas can do, nor is it the realm of all pratyekbuddhas, but it's something practiced by all bodhisattvas and realized by all the buddhas who are correctly enlightened.

source_sentence: 王當安心勿令散亂，應作是念：『我當云何於未來世一切世間天人之中，得為燈明、為炬、為光、為船、為導、為師，得為商主、為首、為無上，自度度彼，自脫脫彼，自安安彼，自得涅槃令他涅槃？』
translation: The king should be at ease and not allow himself to be distracted, and he should think, 'How will I, among all the gods and humans of the future, become a lamp, a torch, a light, a ship, a guide, a teacher, a merchant, a leader, and unsurpassed, passing myself over them, liberating myself from them, making myself comfortable with them, and attaining nirvāṇa for myself so that others may attain nirvāṇa?'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 觀先際所經豪富自在，大王當知，諸根如幻，無有厭足、無能滿者；境界如夢，不能令滿。
translation: Looking at the wealth and independence of what we've experienced in the past, you should know, Great King, that these faculties are illusory and have nothing to tire of and nothing to fulfill, and that the objective realm is like a dream that can't be made to fulfill.

source_sentence: 「大王！
translation: "Great king!

source_sentence: 過去有王名曰尼彌，了達諸法如法為王，重不放逸，若所作事離諸放逸。
translation: In the past, there was a king named Nimi who comprehended things as they were meant to be understood, was serious about not being careless, and did things free of carelessness.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 是尼彌王常觀三世平等，又觀一切諸法猶如三世平等，觀過去一切諸法遠離自性，觀未來一切諸法遠離自性，觀現在法亦復如是遠離自性。
translation: King Nimi always observes the equality of the three times, observes all things as if they were equal in the three times, observes that all past things are free of their own nature, observes that all future things are free of their own nature, and observes that present things are likewise free of their own nature.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 彼尼彌王觀一切三世法平等已，於諸法不生取著。
translation: After observing the equality of all three worldly dharmas, that Nimi-rāja king doesn't become attached to those dharmas.

source_sentence: 彼尼彌王觀一切世間為四顛倒之所顛倒，於不淨法中而起淨想，於苦法中而生樂想，於無常法中而起常想，於無我法中而生我想。
translation: Observing that all the world is mistaken by the four errors, that Nimi King gives rise to perceptions of purity in impure things, happiness in painful things, permanence in impermanent things, and self in selfless things.

source_sentence: 見世如是，便作是念：『世間則壞甚大敗壞。
translation: Seeing the world as it is, they then think, 'The world is destroyed, and it's greatly corrupted.'

source_sentence: 如此眾生，一切諸法自性空寂而不覺知。』
translation: Such a sentient being doesn't realize that all things are empty of their own nature.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌王復作如是念：『我當以四攝法攝諸眾生。
translation: King Nimi then again had this thought, 'I will use the four methods of collecting sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若我四法攝眾生者，是諸眾生隨順於我、受我言教。』
translation: If I use these four ways to gather in sentient beings, then those sentient beings will obey me and accept my words and teachings.'

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌大王先作是方便已，即以四攝攝諸眾生。
translation: After first doing this, King Nimi made it a point to gather in sentient beings with the four methods of gathering them in.

source_sentence: 攝諸眾生已，尼彌大王即教人民一切諸法平等，作如是言：『汝諸眾生，一切諸法離於自性。
translation: After gathering in all sentient beings, King Nimi taught the people that all things are equal, saying, 'You sentient beings, all things are free of their own nature.

source_sentence: 若一切法離自性者，彼法亦非過去非未來非現在。
translation: If all things are free of their own nature, they weren't in the past, weren't in the future, and weren't present.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼法自性無實故。
translation: The self-nature of that dharma is not real.

source_sentence: 若法離自性者，彼法亦不可說是過去未來現在。』
translation: If a dharma is free of its own nature, it can't be said to be past, future, or present.'

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 爾時彼尼彌王於彼眾生所教是三世平等法已，彼諸眾生八十千萬那由他無量百千眾生得無生法忍。
translation: After King Nimi taught those sentient beings this teaching about the equality of the three times, 800,000,000,000,000,000 sentient beings attained the patience of the nonarising of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 爾時三十三天在善法堂聚集而坐，作是議言：『善哉善哉！
translation: At the time, the Trāyastriṃśa gods gathered in the hall of the good dharma and sat down, saying, 'Good, good!

source_sentence: 鞞提呵國人大獲善利。
translation: The people of Videha were greatly benefited.

source_sentence: 是尼彌王解了諸法如法為王，具足方便，於顛倒眾生所以善方便示不顛倒法也。』
translation: This is King Nimi, who understands things as they are and is the king of the Dharma, fully equipped with skillful means to show mistaken sentient beings the Dharma that's not mistaken.'

source_sentence: 爾時釋提桓因在於餘處去善法堂遠，即以天耳聞彼天說，聞已尋來詣善法堂就座而坐。
translation: Śakrodevānāmī was somewhere else far from the hall of the good dharma when he heard what they said with the divine ear, and after hearing it, he rushed to the hall of the good dharma, took his seat, and sat down.

source_sentence: 既就座已，問彼天言：『汝諸天等在善法堂何所論說？』
translation: Once he had taken his seat, he asked the gods, 'What did you gods discuss in the Hall of the Good Dharma?'

source_sentence: 作是問已，時諸天等報帝釋言：『唯然天主！
translation: After asking this question, the gods then answered Tīrṣa, saying, 'Yes, Lord!

source_sentence: 聽我所說，我等向來集善法堂所論之事。
translation: "Listen to what I've told you about the matters we've discussed since we gathered here at the Hall of the Fine Dharma.

source_sentence: 說彼鞞提呵國人善得利益。
translation: He said that the people of Videha had been well-served.

source_sentence: 是尼彌王解了諸法如法為王，具足方便，於顛倒眾生所以善方便示不顛倒法也，所謂顯示諸法自性。』
translation: This is King Nimi, who understands things as they are and is the king of the Dharma, fully equipped with skillful means to show mistaken sentient beings what's not mistaken, which is to say that he reveals the own-nature of things.'

source_sentence: 彼諸天等作是語已，爾時帝釋報諸天子作如是言：『是尼彌王具足成就不可思議善巧方便。
translation: After the gods said that, then Tishri reported to the sons of gods, saying, 'Is King Nimi fully accomplished in unfathomable skillful means?

source_sentence: 汝等在此忉利天上，欲得見彼尼彌王不？』
translation: Do you want to see that King Nimi while you're here in the Heaven of Truth?"

source_sentence: 爾時諸天咸皆同聲作如是言：『唯然天主！
translation: At that point, the gods all spoke with one voice, saying, 'Yes, Lord!

source_sentence: 我等在此欲得見彼尼彌大王。』
translation: We're here to see him, King Nimi.'

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主即告御臣名摩多梨言：『汝當前來，可疾嚴備諸天千馬寶車，往閻浮提鞞提呵國尼彌王所。
translation: It was then that the lord Indra addressed the royal minister named Mathurī, saying, 'You must quickly come and prepare a thousand chariots of horses and jewels from the gods to go to King Nimi of Jambudvīpa Videha.'

source_sentence: 說如是言：「此是諸天千調馬車，遣來迎王。
translation: He said, 'These are the thousand-horse chariots of the gods that have been sent to meet the king.

source_sentence: 唯願大王昇此寶車勿生怖畏，三十三天悉皆願樂欲見大王。」
translation: Please don't be afraid, Your Majesty, to ascend this precious chariot, for the Trāyastriṃśa gods are all eager to see Your Majesty."

source_sentence: 若上車已，作如是言：「大王！
translation: When he gets on the chariot, he says, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我今將王從何道去詣彼天上？
translation: Now, from what path will I send the king to the heavens?

source_sentence: 為從住顛倒地眾生道而去？
translation: In order to depart from the path of sentient beings who reside in a state of delusion?

source_sentence: 為從住不顛倒地眾生道而去也？」』
translation: In order to depart from the stage of abiding in the path of sentient beings who are not mistaken?"

source_sentence: 爾時摩多梨答帝釋言：『唯然受教。』
translation: It was then that Mathurī answered Tissa, 'Yes, I'll accept your teaching.'

source_sentence: 聞此語已，即便嚴備千調馬車，自昇其上，從彼忉利下閻浮提，至鞞提呵國尼彌王所。
translation: After hearing those words, he even decorated a thousand chariots, ascended them, and went down from the Thirty-three heavens to Yambudvīpa to King Nimi of Videha.

source_sentence: 語尼彌王作如是言：『忉利諸天今送千調馬車，王可昇車勿生怖畏，忉利諸天願樂見王。』
translation: He said to King Nimi, 'The gods of the Thirty-three heavens have now sent this thousand-toned chariot, so the king may ascend it without fear, and the gods of the Thirty-three heavens will be delighted to see the king.'

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌大王以無畏心便即登之。
translation: Then, with fearlessness, King Nimi climbed aboard.

source_sentence: 既昇車已，摩多梨作如是言：『我今將王從何道去？
translation: After he had climbed into the chariot, Mathurī said, 'What path will I take the king from now?'

source_sentence: 為從住顛倒地眾生道去？
translation: In order to depart from the path of sentient beings who reside in a state of delusion?

source_sentence: 為從住不顛倒地眾生道去？』
translation: In order to depart from the path of sentient beings who abide in a state of no delusion?'

source_sentence: 王即報言：『汝可將我從彼二道中間而去。』
translation: The king then reported, 'You may allow me to depart from the middle of those two paths.'

source_sentence: 爾時摩多梨即將尼彌王，從顛倒地眾生所、不顛倒地眾生所二處而去。
translation: It was then that Mathurī took King Nimi and departed from both the place of sentient beings in the mistaken state and the place of sentient beings in the non-confused state.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌王語摩多梨言：『汝可少時停車而住，我當觀彼顛倒眾生所住之處。』
translation: King Nimi then said to Mathāli, 'Stop for a short time while I observe where those mistaken sentient beings are staying.'

source_sentence: 時摩多梨即受王教，暫止馬車。
translation: That's when Mathāli was instructed by the king to stop his chariot for a while.

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌王於少時間，令八十千萬眾生安住見實三昧中。
translation: At that point, King Nimi caused 800 million sentient beings to abide in the samādhi of seeing the truth for a short time.

source_sentence: 何以故是王於少時間令如是眾住見實三昧中？
translation: Why did the king cause such a multitude to abide in the samādhi of seeing the truth for a little while?

source_sentence: 此王善習不放逸行故。
translation: "It's because this king well cultivates the practice of noncarelessness.

source_sentence: 令此眾生住三昧者，於後悉得無生法忍。
translation: He causes these sentient beings to abide in samādhi and then attain the patience of the nonarising of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 是時摩多梨都不覺知王所為作。
translation: At the time, Mathurī didn't even realize what the king was doing.

source_sentence: 爾時摩多梨又復將王到須彌頂。
translation: It was then that Mathurī again led the king to the summit of Sumeru.

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌王遙見青茂叢林，告摩多梨言：『彼林定是不顛倒眾生所居之處』。
translation: King Nimi then saw a verdant grove from a distance and told Mathāri, 'That grove must be a place where sentient beings who aren't mistaken live.'

source_sentence: 摩多梨言：『大王！
translation: Mathāli said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 此是忉利諸天善法之堂，彼忉利天眾集在堂上欲得見王。
translation: 'This is the hall of the good Dharma of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, where the multitude of the Thirty-three gods gather to see the king.

source_sentence: 惟願大王勿生怖畏當昇此堂。』
translation: May it please the king not to become frightened and ascend to this hall.'

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌王心不恐懼便昇堂上。
translation: At that point, King Nimi's mind wasn't frightened and he ascended to the hall.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋遙見尼彌王來，即作是言：『善來大王！』
translation: Indra then saw King Nimi coming from a distance and said, 'Well done, great king!'

source_sentence: 便分半座命王令座。
translation: He then ordered the king to sit on half of his seat.

source_sentence: 時尼彌王即就帝釋半座而坐。
translation: King Nimi then took Tīrṣa's half of the seat and sat down.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋即以美言共相慰問言：『大王！
translation: Tīrṣa then spoke beautifully to each other and greeted him, saying, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 快獲善利，能令佛法熾然增長。』
translation: Quickly attaining good benefits, it will cause the Buddha's teaching to blaze forth.'

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋向忉利天眾作如是言：『此尼彌王成就具足不可思議善巧方便。
translation: It was then that Śakra addressed the multitude of the Dharma Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials and said, 'This Nimi King has accomplished an unfathomably skilled skillful means.

source_sentence: 是王於少時間能令八十千萬眾生住佛法中，然摩多梨都不覺知。』
translation: In a little while, this king was able to cause 800 million sentient beings to abide in the Buddha's teachings, but Mathurī didn't even know it.'

source_sentence: 爾時尼彌王即為忉利諸天廣說種種勝妙之法。
translation: King Nimi then spoke extensively about various wonderful things for the Heaven of the Thirty-three.

source_sentence: 利益天眾已，白帝釋言：『我今欲得還閻浮提。
translation: After he had benefited the gods, he said to Śakra, 'Now, I want to return to Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 於閻浮提為欲護持佛正法故。』
translation: I'm in Jambudvīpa because I want to protect the Buddha's right teaching.'

source_sentence: 帝釋報言：『今正是時。』
translation: Tīrṣa replied, 'Now is the right time.'

source_sentence: 復勅御臣摩多梨言：『汝可還駕千調馬車，送尼彌王還歸閻浮。』
translation: I also commanded my royal servant Mathurī to say, 'Go back in your chariot of a thousand horses and escort King Nimi back to Yambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 其尼彌王到閻浮提已，成就大悲善巧方便，令無量眾生安住佛法。
translation: After he arrived in Yambudvī, King Nimi accomplished the skillful means of great compassion to help measureless sentient beings abide in the Buddha's teachings.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 莫作異疑，勿生異觀。
translation: Don't have different doubts, and don't look at it differently.

source_sentence: 昔尼彌王者，我身是也。
translation: That was King Nimi in the past, and that's who I am.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 當觀不放逸力難可思議。
translation: It's hard to fathom the power of noncarelessness.

source_sentence: 尼彌大王昇帝釋座尚無貪著！
translation: King Nimi ascends to the Tissa throne, yet he has no craving!

source_sentence: 是故大王！
translation: Therefore, great king!

source_sentence: 於佛法中當勤精進修不放逸。
translation: You must diligently apply yourself to cultivating the Buddha's teachings without laziness.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 何謂佛法？
translation: What is meant by the Buddha-dharma?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great King!

source_sentence: 一切諸法皆是佛法。」
translation: All things are the Buddha's teachings."

translation: The dharmas are really unobtainable, and the Buddha only speaks falsely for sentient beings."

translation: When the Bhagavān explained this teaching, 70,000 Śākyamunis, including King Jōtan, attained the patience of the nonarising of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知諸釋種得深信已而現微笑。
translation: The Bhagavān then smiled when he realized that the ascetics had attained deep conviction.

source_sentence: 爾時慧命馬勝比丘以偈問曰：「大雄尊導師，　　為世現微笑，　惟願世明炬，　　演說微笑事。
translation: At that point, the monk Wise Life Masaru asked in a verse, "Venerable Guide Mahāyāna, you've shown yourself smiling for the world, so may the world's torch of wisdom explain what's smiling.

source_sentence: 十力一切智，　　何因現微笑？
translation: What is the cause for the smiling face of the ten powers and omniscience?

source_sentence: 願說彼笑因，　　斷世諸疑網。
translation: "May he explain the cause of their smiles and cut off the world's webs of doubt.

source_sentence: 佛為釋眾故，　　而現微笑瑞，　為諸人天眾，　　速除諸疑網。
translation: For the sake of the liberated multitude, the Buddha showed a smile that quickly removed the web of doubt for all the people and gods.

source_sentence: 得聞大雄說，　　世間離諸疑，　其心皆欣喜，　　安住佛法中。
translation: Hearing the great hero's teaching, the world is freed from doubt, and their hearts are elated as they abide in the Buddha's teaching.

source_sentence: 世尊諸子等，　　得知微笑事，　堅固住誓願，　　智慧必通達。
translation: The Bhagavān's sons and daughters, knowing what's smiling, firmly abide in their vow, and their wisdom will penetrate.

source_sentence: 唯願尊導師，　　斷除大眾疑，　眾等除疑已，　　必得廣大樂。」
translation: May it please the venerable guide to remove the doubts of the masses, and once they remove their doubts, they'll surely attain great happiness."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以偈答馬勝曰：「我現寂滅笑，　　馬勝當諦聽，　我今如實說，　　釋種決定智。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān answered Mañjuśrī in a verse, "Now, I'm smiling serenely, so Mañjuśrī should listen closely as I truly explain it with the cognition that explains the determination of seeds.

source_sentence: 諸法不可得，　　釋種皆得知，　是故於佛法，　　決定心安住。
translation: All dharmas are unknowable, but the types of explanation are all known; therefore, in the Buddha's teaching, one's mind is settled in certainty.

source_sentence: 名稱大釋種，　　依於無所得，　當得上菩提，　　曉知一切法。
translation: They're called the great element of explanation, which relies on the ungraspable and will lead to supreme enlightenment and knowledge of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 人中命終已，　　此釋種決定，　得生安樂國，　　面奉無量壽。
translation: After his life ends, this element of explanation determines that he'll be born in the Land of Peace and Bliss and face to face worship of immeasurable life.

source_sentence: 住安樂國已，　　無畏成菩提，　能趣十方界，　　供養無量佛。
translation: After living in the Land of Peace and Bliss, they fearlessly achieve enlightenment, travel to the worlds of the ten directions, and make offerings to measureless buddhas.

source_sentence: 安住一佛土，　　能供十方佛，　愍諸眾生故，　　而求無上道。
translation: They'll abide in one Buddha land, make offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions, and seek the unsurpassed path out of pity for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 遊歷諸佛國，　　供養彼佛等，　皆已神力到，　　隨佛所出處。
translation: He travels to the buddha lands, makes offerings to the buddhas, and so forth, all arriving with supernormal powers to follow where the buddhas depart.

source_sentence: 無量僧祇劫，　　供養諸導師，　以種種妙供，　　後當成佛道。
translation: For measureless incalculably long eons, they've made offerings to their teachers and made various marvelous offerings, and then they'll achieve the buddhahood.

source_sentence: 一一成佛已，　　能度無量眾，　令得成佛道，　　復化諸眾生。
translation: After each one becomes a buddha, he'll be able to save measureless multitudes, cause them to achieve the buddha path, and then transform sentient beings.

source_sentence: 彼國眾生輩，　　皆當成佛道，　彼諸世尊等，　　不度聲聞眾。
translation: All of the sentient beings in that country will achieve the buddha path, and those world-honored ones won't save the śrāvaka multitude.

source_sentence: 一一諸佛等，　　俱壽一劫歲，　彼佛正法住，　　無量阿僧祇。
translation: Each of those buddhas will live an eon, and his true teaching will abide for measureless incalculably long.

source_sentence: 彼佛滅度後，　　大智菩薩眾，　持法化於世，　　億歲阿僧祇。
translation: After that Buddha's extinction, that multitude of bodhisattvas of great wisdom will maintain the Dharma and teach the world for a hundred million years and incalculably long years.

source_sentence: 彼諸佛子等，　　教化無量眾，　置於無上道，　　說法悉空寂。
translation: Those sons of the Buddha taught measureless multitudes, placed them on the unsurpassed path, and explained that the Dharma is entirely empty and quiescent.

source_sentence: 令住不放逸，　　修集空寂法，　能得一切智，　　樂不放逸事。」
translation: They cause them to abide without dissipation, cultivate the practice of emptiness and quiescence, attain omniscience, and enjoy the practice of non-dissipation."

source_sentence: 聞是釋種趣，　　世尊所說者，　天人咸欣喜，　　志求於佛道。
translation: Hearing this explanation of the various destinies and what the Bhagavān taught, the gods and humans rejoiced and aspired to pursue the Buddha Way.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告慧命舍利弗：「舍利弗！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Śāriputra, the life of Wisdom, "Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 此是菩薩見真實三昧，汝當為阿毘跋智諸菩薩說之。
translation: "This is the concentration in which bodhisattvas see the reality, and you will explain it to the bodhisattvas of Abhidharma.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 此三昧不可得說。
translation: "This samādhi can't be explained.

source_sentence: 而如來於彼三昧中不得一法，若不得者彼不可覺，若不可覺者彼則不可說，若不可說者彼則不可知，彼不可知者即是過去未來現在諸佛之法。
translation: In that samādhi, the Tathāgata doesn't know a single thing, and if he doesn't know it, then he doesn't understand it, and if he doesn't understand it, then he doesn't know it, and what he doesn't know is the teaching of the buddhas of the past, future, and present.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: *Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 我今付囑於汝，此是菩薩見實三昧，應當受持讀誦廣為顯說。
translation: I now entrust to you that this is the bodhisattva's samādhi of seeing the truth, which should be memorized, recited, and explained in detail.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！
translation: *Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 若有善男子善女人住大乘者，經歷十劫修行五波羅蜜、離般若波羅蜜；若復有人得聞是菩薩見實三昧者，所得福德復過於彼。
translation: "If there are good men and good women who abide in the great vehicle and go through ten eons cultivating the five perfections and the perfection of separation, then if another person hears this bodhisattva's vision of true concentration, they'll again attain merit greater than theirs.

source_sentence: 若復有善男子善女人暫得聞菩薩見真實三昧；若復有人得聞是菩薩見真實三昧已，為一人說者，此人得福復勝於彼。
translation: If another good man or good woman hears for a moment that the bodhisattva sees true concentration, and if another person hears that the bodhisattva sees true concentration and then teaches it for one person, that person will again attain more merit than that person.

source_sentence: 若復善男子善女人，經歷十劫聞已為他解說；若復有人，乃至一剎那間修此菩薩見真實三昧者，所得福德復過於彼。
translation: If another good man or woman goes through ten eons of hearing it and then explains it for another person, then that person will again attain more merit than that person, even if they cultivate the true concentration of the bodhisattva's views in a single moment.

source_sentence: 是故舍利弗！
translation: Therefore, Śāriputra!

source_sentence: 汝應以此菩薩見真實三昧經，為諸菩薩說教示修行。
translation: You should use this sutra on the bodhisattva's vision of true samādhi to teach and instruct bodhisattvas in its cultivation.

source_sentence: 舍利弗！

source_sentence: 若修此菩薩見實三昧者，當獲無生法忍。
translation: If someone cultivates this bodhisattva's samādhi of seeing the truth, they will attain the patience of the nonarising of the Dharma.

translation: All the bodhisattvas in the path of the unsurpassed one that I've instructed in this assembly will be able to abide in the samādhi of the bodhisattva's true views."

translation: At the time, all the bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, gods, and humans, asuras, gandharvas, humans, and nonhumans who heard what the Buddha taught rejoiced and handed it down.
